wikipedia_page.main: Leonard "Len" Aston (14 June 1920 – 19 November 1987)  was an English professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1930s, 1940s and 1950s. He played at representative level for Great Britain and England, and at club level for St. Helens, as a centre, prop, second-row or loose forward, i.e. number 3 or 4, 8 or 10, 11 or 12, or 13 during the era of contested scrums.
